Until Trump comes to Congress with a rational plan to stabilize the region, Congress will continue to demand that this President tell us what his strategy is and the justification for his military decisions. (13/13)

This Administration’s foreign policy in the Middle East is not only a grave embarrassment to our country, it will likely put Americans – including our servicemembers and diplomats - in harm’s way. (12/13)

What’s his plan for the future? Another decade of conflict? The President has failed to present a coherent plan to bring stability to the Middle East and walked away from a successful plan to reign in Iran’s nuclear ambitions. (11/13)
So far we have seen zero credible evidence of this type of threat and the Administration has failed to provide legal rationale for this strike. (10/13)

Not only do we now have an Iranian regime back on track to develop nuclear weapons, our NATO allies no longer trust us because Trump put their soldiers in Iraq at risk. We have a president who constantly derides NATO but asks for their help to fix his mess. (6/13)

and forced Iran to fill nuclear reactors with concrete – rendering them permanently inoperable. It had the full support of our European allies. (4/13)

Contrary to what the Trump Administration said, the Iran Nuclear Deal was working. (2/13)

Only Congress has the power to authorize military force. The American people do not want war with Iran, and I will do everything in my power to prevent the President from dragging America into another dangerous, drawn-out conflict.

That’s why my colleagues and I passed H. Con. Res. 83, a bipartisan War Powers Resolution to prevent the President from using military force against Iran unless Congress authorizes it or unless it is necessary to defend our country from imminent attack.

The President escalated conflict with Iran, using force that only Congress can authorize under the Constitution. He has ignored Congress’s constitutional authority and put the safety of our service members at risk in the process.
